sentences.english: But Wang's peers didn't think he deserved a strong punishment.
sentences.chinese: 但王林的同齡人卻不認爲他應受重罰。

sentences.english: President Medvedev also called for tough punishment against officers who will abuse their position.
sentences.chinese: 梅德奧傑夫亦對濫用職權的官員予以重罰。

sentences.english: He who beholds the gods against their will, shall atone for it by a heavy penalty.
sentences.chinese: 誰違背神的意志看見了神，就要受到重罰以贖罪。

sentences.english: Any men caught impersonating women will be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人化裝成女士，一經發現便將受到重罰。

sentences.english: When you are cheating because you want money you will have lots of lots of heavy punishments. First they will quit you from job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你爲了錢去作弊，那你將遭到重罰。

sentences.english: And a court slapped a big fine on an opposition newspaper for slandering a parliamentarian.
sentences.chinese: 法院對一家異議報紙因爲抨擊國會苛以重罰。

definition: driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
